Hi. Basic Wi-Fi question. If I use an unencrypted 802.11 connection, then anyone can sniff what I write. If I use an encrypted-but-with-a-known-password connection, then unless an attacker (with knowledge of the password) saw when I started the session (sharing the IVs), he can't snoop on my data. Is that last part right?
flebron: correct. so what the attacker does is send a deauth, and you client is kind a enough to automatically reconnect and show IV
but below means you are in the range of most port scan worms
if you're using a different port number for "security" you're doing it wron
